properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Newcastle Jets v Sydney FC at McDonald Jones Stadium. Kick-off at 3pm, full time around 5pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

The Millthorpe Markets will take place at Redmond Oval on Sunday 7 April between 8:30am and 3:00pm. Church Street and Crowson Street will be closed from Pearce Street to Millthorpe Road. Motorists should be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area and follow the direction of signs and traffic controllers.

properties.publicTransport: Shuttle buses will run from local areas. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Ramadan Nights markets will be held on Haldon Street, The Boulevard and Railway Parade in Lakemba every Thursday to Sunday, 6pm-3am from 9 March to 8 April.

Heavy traffic is expected in the area, particularly during the busy weeknight peaks on Thursdays and Fridays during the event.

Changed traffic conditions will be in place each night, motorists should allow plenty of extra time

Road closures from 5pm to 3am each night from 9 March to 8 April.  

  • Haldon St between Railway Pde and The Boulevarde
  • Haldon St between 178 Haldon St and Grace Ave
  • The Boulevarde between Croydon St and Oneata Ln
  • The Boulevarde between Quigg St and Haldon St
  • Gillies St between Quigg St and Haldon St
  • Oneata St between Croydon St Haldon St

Follow the directions of traffic controllers and NSW Police on site.
properties.diversions:
Southbound traffic on Haldon St north of the railway line will be detoured using Railway Pde, Moreton St, The Blvd, Quigg St, Grace Ave and Haldon St to Canterbury Rd.

Northbound traffic on Haldon St will be detoured using Grace Ave, Quigg St, The Blvd and Moreton St to Lakemba St.

Eastbound traffic on The Blvd west of Haldon St will be detoured using Croydon St to Canterbury Rd.

Westbound traffic on The Blvd east of Haldon St will be detoured using Quigg St, Grace Ave and Haldon St to Canterbury Rd.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Super Rugby: Waratahs v Crusaders at Allianz Stadium. Kick-off at 7.35pm, full time around 9.10pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads around Moore Park as fans travel to the match. Allow extra travel time on roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

  • Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 3.45pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.
  • No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave, however access to EP3 grass car park and drop-off areas will be maintained from Lang Rd (car park open from 4.30pm). EP2 Kippax car park will not be open for this match.
  • Parking is also available nearby at the Entertainment Quarter Wilson car park, however please note that spaces may be limited up until 5pm while Sydney Family Show attendees leave the precinct.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until 11pm including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Knights v Roosters at McDonald Jones Stadium. Preliminary game from 5:20pm. NRL kick-off from 7:50pm, finish around 9:50pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium during Thursday evening peak.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Routes 549, 550, 600, 601 and 606 may be be diverting and using different stops while roads are closed outside the stadium. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Eels v Cowboys at CommBank Stadium. Kick-off at 5:30pm and full time 7:15pm.

Large crowds are expected and traffic will be heavy on roads approaching and within Parramatta. Allow extra travel time on Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd.

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium.

Roads outside the stadium will close for up to an hour after the game to allow crowds to safely leave the precinct. Be patient leaving car parks as traffic will be heavy and follow the directions of traffic controllers and Police.

While closures are in place motorists are encouraged to avoid driving through Parramatta CBD and detour around the closures via Grose St, Brickfield St, Victoria Rd and Wilde Ave in both directions.

Motorists should follow the directions of traffic controllers and NSW Police and allow extra time when exiting car parks. Fans travelling home by taxi or ride share choose a pick up location away from the stadium to avoid traffic delays.

NRL: Wests Tigers v St George Illawarra Dragons at Campbelltown Sports Stadium. Kick-off from 4pm, full time around 6pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual as fans travel to the stadium. Allow extra travel time on roads including Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd.

Motorists should also be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

roads.mainStreet: Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive

properties.publicTransport: Tickets to Rabbitohs match include travel on public transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Rabbitohs v Sharks at Accor Stadium. NSW Cup kick-off at 5:10pm. NRL kick-off at 7:35pm, full time around 9:20pm.

Concert: Hauser at Qudos Bank Arena from 8pm to 10pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park as fans travel to and from both events. Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

  • CAR PARKS: Pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space.
  • Consider parking at a nearby train station commuter carpark and continuing your trip on one of the many extra trains running to Olympic Park, at no extra cost.
  • If you have pre-booked your parking, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.

properties.publicTransport:
With Maitland Railway Station being the main hub of the event. Gettting here via train is the easiest way to get to Steamfest. 

Please visit Hunter Valley Steamfest 2024 | transportnsw.info for full timetable information.
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 60,000 people are expected to attend the Hunter Valley Steamfest event at Maitland Station over the weekend of 13 and 14 April 2024.

Traffic is expected to be heavy approaching Maitland especially along Cessnock Road, New England Highway, Les Darcy Drive, High Street, Allan Walsh Drive and Ken Tubman Drive.

Motorists are advised to expect delays in the area and follow detours and direction of traffic controllers in the area.
properties.diversions: Local road closures and diversions will be in place.

properties.publicTransport: Light rail services run regularly. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Championships Day 2 at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race at 11.35am, last race at 5.10pm followed by a concert.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as crowds travel to the races.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads, and high volumes of taxi and rideshare pick ups and drop offs.

Special event clearways will be in effect around the racecourse at the following locations and times on Saturday 13 April:

  • From 4am to 7pm: Darley Rd between Alison Rd and Randwick Gates Centennial Park (western side)
  • From 8am to 7pm: Ascot St between Doncaster Ave and Randwick Racecourse Ascot St Entry (both sides)
  • From 3pm to 7pm: High St between UNSW Gate Two and Anzac Pde (southern side)

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street

webLinks.linkText: A Day on the Green - Chris Isaak

properties.otherAdvice:
A Day on the Green with Chris Isaak will be held at Centennial Vineyards on 14 April from 3pm to 9pm.

Reduced speed and stop-slow traffic management will be in place on Mittagong Rd as motorists arrive and leave the event.

Traffic controllers will be on-site to direct motorists.

webLinks.linkText: RSL NSW - Anzac Day Sydney CBD
NSW Government - Anzac Day in NSW

properties.publicTransport: Travel on public transport is free on Anzac Day for veterans and families. Additional early morning services will run. Buses will be diverting while roads are closed and Light rail services will not run between Circular Quay and Town Hall until 6am during the Dawn Service. Visit transportnsw.info for details.
properties.otherAdvice:
Major roads will be closed in the Sydney CBD for the Anzac Day Dawn Service in Martin Place from 4:20am and for the March on Elizabeth St from 9am. 

Motorists should avoid travelling through the CBD while roads are closed or expect delays and allow extra travel time. While roads are closed travel east/west across the CBD is maintained via Bridge St or via Goulburn St.

Key road closures:

  • From 2am to 4pm: Pitt St, George St and Castlereagh St between Hunter St and King St. Local streets will also be closed including Hosking Pl and De Mestre Pl.
  • From 2am to 6pm: Angel Pl and Ash St.
  • From 6am to 4pm: Major roads between Bridge St in Circular Quay and Goulburn St in the CBD South, including sections of Castlereagh St, Elizabeth St, King St, Market St, Pitt St, Margaret St, Hunter St, O’Connell St, Gresham St, Bent St, Park St, Bathurst St, Bligh St, Phillip St, Loftus St and Liverpool St.

There will be no managed vehicle access or access to/from driveways within the road closure footprint for the safety of participants and spectators. Pedestrians can cross the March route at the designated crossing point on Elizabeth St at Park St, Bathurst St, Museum Station underground crossings, and at Hunter St.

Cycleway closures will be in place on Pitt St from 2am to 4pm, and on sections of King St, Liverpool St, Park St, Pitt St and Phillip St from 6am to 4pm.

Extensive special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect on various major roads in the Sydney CBD from 1am around Martin Place and from 5.30am on other major roads. All roads are due to reopen by 4pm.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents, businesses or TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies so check signs carefully on the day and the night before as clearways come into effect in the early morning. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
A footpath closure will be in place on Market Street in the Sydney CBD as crowds are expected to attend a film premiere at the State Theatre from 6pm.

Traffic delays may be experienced along Market St during the event.

From 2pm to 9pm the southern footpath along Market St between Pitt St and George St will be closed to pedestrians.

Motorists should allow extra travel time in the area and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads around the theatre.

properties.publicTransport: Light rail and buses run regularly to Moore Park. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Sydney Kidz Fest will be held at The Entertainment Quarter from Saturday 13 April to Sunday 28 April from 10am daily until 3pm Monday to Wednesday, and until 4pm Thursday to Sunday.

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St and Lang Rd approaching Moore Park as families travel to and from the festival each day. Motorists should allow extra travel time in the area and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

The precinct will be particularly busy while events are held at neighbouring Allianz Stadium, Sydney Cricket Ground and Hordern Pavilion so allow plenty of extra travel time as parking will be in demand on these days.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in and around Moore Park on game days during the festival including Saturday 13 April, Thursday 18 April, Saturday 21 April, Thursday 25 April, Friday 26 April and Sunday 28 April. Check signs carefully before parking as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
Bring Me The Horizon concerts will be taking place at Qudos Bank Arena on Friday 12 and Sunday 14 April from 6.10pm til 10.50pm approx.

Traffic may be heavy on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park while attendees travel to and from the precinct.

Allow extra travel time on the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Attendees who need to drive are urged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space - available until 11:59pm the night before the events unless sold out prior.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. View the interactive map for closure details.

properties.otherAdvice: The Sampson St Lunch is an event part of Orange F.O.O.D Week (Food of Orange District) festival, and will be held on Saturday 6 April from 12pm to 4pm. Sampson St will be closed from 7am to 7pm. Local resident access is permitted during the event set up from 8am to 11.30am. Sampson St will be closed to all traffic from 11.30am to 6pm. Motorists travelling on Mitchell Hwy (Summer St) will not be able to access Sampson St between the Mitchell Hwy and Byng St. Westbound right turn lane on Mitchell Hwy will be closed preventing westbound motorists from turning right off Mitchell Hwy into Sampson St. Eastbound motorists travelling along the Mitchell Hwy will also be unable to turn left into Sampson St. Sign posted detours will be in place.
properties.diversions: Detour via Mitchell Hwy, Woodward St or Clinton St and Byng St.
properties.displayName: Orange F.O.O.D Week - Sampson Street Long Lunch

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on public transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Rabbitohs v Warriors at Accor Stadium. NSW Cup kick-off at 12.40pm. NRL kick-off at 3pm, full time around 4.45pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park as fans travel to and from the match. Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Attendees who need to drive are encouraged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Consider parking at a nearby train station commuter carpark and continuing your trip on one of the many extra trains running to Olympic Park, at no extra cost.

If you have pre-booked your parking, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.

Road closures are in place within the Sydney Olympic Park Precinct until Wednesday 10 April for the Royal Easter Show. Check out the interactive map or the community information page for more details.

arrangementElements.html:
Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct from Friday to Monday to ensure pedestrian safety during events and accommodate additional transport services. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.publicTransport: Light rail services run regularly. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Championships Day 1 at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race at 11.35pm, last race at 5.10pm followed by a concert.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as crowds travel to the races.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads, and high volumes of taxi and rideshare pick ups and drop offs.

Special event clearways will be in effect around the racecourse at the following locations and times on Saturday 6 April:

  • From 4am to 7pm: Darley Rd between Alison Rd and Randwick Gates Centennial Park (western side)
  • From 8am to 7pm: Ascot St between Doncaster Ave and Randwick Racecourse Ascot St Entry (both sides)
  • From 3pm to 7pm: High St between UNSW Gate Two and Anzac Pde (southern side)

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Central Coast Mariners v Wellington Phoenix at Industree Group Stadium. Kick-off at 5.30pm finish around 7.20pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game.

Dane Dr will close before the match from 3.30pm between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St for the safety of pedestrians and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Additional route 199 buses will also run towards Manly and Mona Vale after the game to help you get home. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Sea Eagles v Panthers at 4 Pines Park in Brookvale. NSW Cup kick off at 3pm. NRL kick-off at 5.30pm, full time around 7.30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pittwater Rd, Old Pittwater Rd, Warringah Rd and Beacon Hill Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and plan to arrive early as parking will be in high demand, and also be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

webLinks.linkText: Cinema under the stars event page

properties.otherAdvice:
Cinema under the stars will be held at Speers Point Park, The Esplanade on Saturday 6 April.

On the Esplanade just near Park Road there will be a portable signalised pedestrian crossing to allow for the increase in pedestrian activity.

Motorists should allow extra travel time, reduce speed and watch for pedestrians.

webLinks.linkText: City of Sydney - Sydney Streets series on Crown Street

properties.publicTransport: Route 304 and 352 buses are diverting while roads are closed. Check bus service alerts and plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways are in place for City of Sydney's Sydney Streets event on Crown Street. The event runs from 11am until 10pm.

  • Crown St is closed in both directions between Cleveland St and Foveaux St from 9am until 11:30pm
  • Sections of Arthur St, Collins St, Davies St, Devonshire St, Jesson Ln, Jesson St, Landsowne St, Miles St, Rainford St and Withers Ln are also closed.
  • Motorists travelling from the south towards the city should detour via Cleveland St, Elizabeth St and Albion St.
  • Motorists travelling from the north should detour via Foveaux St, Elizabeth St and Cleveland St.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity

Special event clearways are in effect from 8am until 11:30pm on sections of Crown St, Arthur St, Collins St, Davies St, Landsdowne St, Rainford St and Withers Ln.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

SURRY HILLS

FROM 9AM TO 11:30PM

  • Arthur Street between Tudor Lane and Crown Street
  • Arthur Street between Crown Street and Collins Lane
  • Collins Street between Crown Street and Richards Lane
  • Crown Street between Cleveland Street and Foveaux Street
  • Davies Street *1 between Bourke Street and Crown Street
  • Devonshire Street *2 between Wilshire St and Crown St Westbound
  • Jesson Lane from Jesson Street
  • Jesson Street at Crown Street
  • Lansdowne Street between High Holborn Street and Crown Street
  • Miles Street *3 at Crown Street
  • Rainford Street between Crown Street and Collins Lane
  • Withers Lane *4 between Riley Street and Crown Street

Notes:

1 Resident egress contra-flow to Bourke Street.

2 Light rail corridor at Devonshire St to always remain open.

3 Resident exit via 2-way contra flow to Bourke Street.

4 Resident exit via 2-way contra flow from High Holborn Street to Lansdowne Street.


SPECIAL EVENT CLEARWAYS

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

SURRY HILLS

FROM 8AM UNTIL 11:30PM

  • Arthur St between Tudor Pl and Crown St
  • Arthur St between Crown St and Collins Ln
  • Collins St between Crown St and Richards Ln
  • Crown St between Cleveland St and Foveaux St
  • Davies St between Crown St and 20m east of Crown St
  • Lansdowne St between Crown St and 20m west of Crown St
  • Rainford St between Crown St and Collins Ln
  • Withers Ln between Withers Pl and Crown St
arrangementElements.title: Road closures and special event clearways

properties.otherAdvice:
The Red Hot Summer Tour will be held on Saturday 6 April at Roche Estate located via Broke and McDonald Roads, Pokolbin from midday until 9.30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the event including Wine Country Drive prior to and following the event. Exercise caution and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area. 


NSW SES advises heavy rainfall is expected to impact the Hunter Valley Friday into Saturday. Plan your trip and ensure extra time prior to traveling. Some roads may be impacted by flash flooding. Do not drive through floodwaters. For assistance during floods, storms and tsunamis call the NSW SES on 132 500 or 000 in a life-threatening emergency.

properties.publicTransport: Bus services may be modified or diverting, and some stops will be missed. Allow extra travel time.
properties.otherAdvice:
